poem:
"Within Thrice Shorn Gold"

In the chill of autumn
the Tory chair proclaims -
twice more shears will meet
the golden fleece of tax.
The votes, thin birds, await
their feast in March, once, then repeat.
Oh, the comments in the wind,
in the rustle of populace leaves -
does the shepherd forecast warmth
or simply bare the hard cold truth?
